Subject: LSAT Analytical Reasoning

Background information: 
LSAT Analytical Reasoning is a section of the Law School Admission Test (LSAT) that evaluates a test-taker's ability to understand and analyze complex relationships between different elements. This section typically includes logic games where candidates have to deduce information and make deductions based on given rules and conditions.
